en: As singers go, she is among the best in the country.
zh: 作为歌手来说，她算得上是全国最好的之一。

en: The girl who I thought was a singer proved to be a different person.
zh: 我以为是歌手的那个女孩，结果是另一个人。

en: The singers sang together in order to raise money to help people with AIDS.
zh: 歌手们一起唱歌，为了筹集资金帮助艾滋病患者。

en: The crowd cheered the singer's entrance.
zh: 人群欢呼歌手的入场。

en: He makes his living by singing.
zh: 他靠唱歌为生。

en: The boy singing a song is my brother.
zh: 那个唱歌的男孩是我弟弟。

en: Let us sing a song.
zh: 让我们唱首歌吧。

en: She knew a lot of songs, too.
zh: 她也知道很多歌。

en: As we were singing songs, we climbed to the top.
zh: 我们一边唱歌，一边爬到了山顶。

en: Hum baby to sleep.
zh: 哼着歌哄宝宝睡觉。

en: Let's sing and dance.
zh: 我们唱歌跳舞吧。

en: Singing is her strong point.
zh: 唱歌是她的强项。

en: A poor singer, he doesn't like to sing in public.
zh: 他唱歌不好，不喜欢在公共场合唱歌。

en: I wish I were a good singer.
zh: 我希望我是一个好歌手。

en: Do you like singing?
zh: 你喜欢唱歌吗？

en: Everything comes to those who wait.
zh: 凡是等待的，都会得到。

en: Would you like some fruit?
zh: 你想吃点水果吗？

en: Please help yourself to some fruit.
zh: 请随便吃点水果。

en: Please help yourself to the fruit.
zh: 请随便吃这些水果。

en: Won't you have some fruit?
zh: 你不想吃点水果吗？

en: Fruits decay in the sun.
zh: 水果在阳光下会腐烂。

en: Fruits tend to decay soon.
zh: 水果容易很快腐烂。

en: I prefer apples to all the other fruits.
zh: 比起其他所有水果，我更喜欢苹果。

en: You seem to like fruit.
zh: 你好像喜欢水果。

en: The fruits are dried in the sun.
zh: 这些水果在阳光下晒干。

en: I burst into tears.
zh: 我突然放声大哭。

en: I suddenly stood up and felt faint and light-headed.
zh: 我突然站起来，感到头晕眼花。

en: I'm sorry we gave you such short notice of our visit.
zh: 很抱歉我们这么晚才通知你们来访。

en: There was a sudden change in her tone.
zh: 她的语气突然变了。

en: Suddenly, he changed the subject.
zh: 他突然转移了话题。

en: I've suddenly started to gain weight.
zh: 我突然开始体重增加。

en: Don't burst out laughing like that. It's creepy.
zh: 别那样突然大笑，怪吓人的。

en: Don't take that dramatic attitude all of a sudden.
zh: 别突然摆出那副戏剧性的姿态。

en: All of a sudden the sky became overcast.
zh: 突然间，天空变得阴沉起来。

en: Suddenly the heavens opened.
zh: 突然下起了倾盆大雨。

en: Suddenly I got lucky.
zh: 我突然走运了。

en: Suddenly rain began to fall.
zh: 突然开始下雨了。

en: All of a sudden, large drops of rain began falling from the dark sky.
zh: 突然间，大滴的雨点从阴暗的天空落下来。

en: I've suddenly lost weight.
zh: 我突然瘦了。

en: Don't brake suddenly.
zh: 不要突然刹车。

en: Suddenly Jim pulled the car up in front of the bank.
zh: 吉姆突然把车停在了银行前面。

en: The storm broke.
zh: 暴风雨来了。

en: All of a sudden, three dogs appeared in front of us.
zh: 突然，三只狗出现在我们面前。

en: If you hurry, you'll catch up with him.
zh: 如果你快点，你就能赶上他。

en: If we hurry, we'll make it.
zh: 如果我们快点，我们就能赶上。

en: Hurry, and you will catch the train.
zh: 快点，你就能赶上火车。

en: If you hurry up, you will be in time.
zh: 如果你快点，你就能及时赶到。

en: I think we'll make it if we hurry.
zh: 我想如果我们快点，我们就能赶上。

en: Hurry up, and you'll catch the bus.
zh: 快点，你就能赶上公共汽车。

en: If you hurry, you can make the next bus.
zh: 如果你快点，你能赶上下一班公共汽车。

en: You'll have to manufacture some kind of excuse.
zh: 你得编个什么借口。

en: I tried to reach you on the phone, but I was unable to get through.
zh: 我试着给你打电话，但是打不通。

en: What a man you are!
zh: 你真是个了不起的人啊！

en: How tall you are!
zh: 你长得真高啊！

en: How kind you are!
zh: 你真好心啊！

en: How rude of you!
zh: 你真没礼貌！

en: How lucky you are!
zh: 你真幸运啊！

en: You're such a cute boy.
zh: 你真是个可爱的小男孩。

en: Do you want anything?
zh: 你想要什么吗？

en: Why can't you come?
zh: 你为什么不能来？

en: Why did you try to run away?
zh: 你为什么要试图逃跑？

en: Why did you not go to the office?
zh: 你为什么没去办公室？

en: Why do you accuse my son?
zh: 你为什么要指责我的儿子？

en: Why did you absent yourself from class yesterday?
zh: 你昨天为什么旷课？

en: What prevented you from coming earlier?
zh: 什么事让你没能早点来？

en: Why do you want to study abroad?
zh: 你为什么想出国留学？

en: Why do you want to buy this book?
zh: 你为什么想买这本书？

en: What do you need the money for?
zh: 你需要这笔钱做什么？

en: Why did you use up all the money?
zh: 你为什么把所有的钱都用光了？

en: What a good thing you say!
zh: 你说得真好啊！

en: You must consider what kind of work you want to do.
zh: 你必须考虑你想做什么样的工作。

en: How long have you been in Japan?
zh: 你在日本多久了？

en: How often do you go abroad?
zh: 你多久出国一次？

en: How long will you stay here?
zh: 你打算在这里待多久？

en: You can always count on Tom.
zh: 你总是可以依靠汤姆。

en: The horses are coming down the track and it's neck and neck.
zh: 赛马正在跑道上飞奔而来，现在是并驾齐驱。

en: Competition is not by nature evil.
zh: 竞争本身在本质上并非邪恶。

en: The competition has become fierce.
zh: 竞争已经变得非常激烈。

en: Having run the race, Jane had two glasses of barley tea.
zh: 跑完比赛后，简喝了两杯大麦茶。

en: Effectively dealing with competition is an important part of life.
zh: 有效地应对竞争是生活的重要组成部分。

en: He came in fifth in the race.
zh: 他在比赛中得了第五名。

en: Competition is neither good nor evil in itself.
zh: 竞争本身既不好也不坏。

en: Competition is not bad in itself.
zh: 竞争本身并没有什么不好。

en: How long does it take to get to the stadium?
zh: 到体育场要多久？

en: How did you get to the stadium?
zh: 你是怎么到体育场的？

en: The athlete was full of spirit and confidence.
zh: 这位运动员精神饱满，充满自信。

en: The athletic meeting went on as scheduled.
zh: 运动会如期举行。

en: Supply is relative to demand.
zh: 供给是相对于需求的。

en: Supplies cannot keep up with the demand.
zh: 供应跟不上需求。

en: The supply can not keep up with the demand.
zh: 供应跟不上需求。

en: Supply will soon overtake demand.
zh: 供应很快就会超过需求。

en: Your name was given to us by Mr. Hayashi of Keiyo Steel Corporation.
zh: 你的名字是庆阳钢铁株式会社的林先生告诉我们的。

en: Do you have a map of the city of Kyoto?
zh: 你有京都市的地图吗？

en: Will you tell me the way to Kyoto Station?
zh: 请你告诉我到京都车站怎么走好吗？

en: You should visit Kyoto.
zh: 你应该去京都看看。

en: You should visit Kyoto, which is famous for its old temples and shrines.
zh: 你应该去参观以古老的寺庙和神社而闻名的京都。

en: Kyoto is worth visiting.
zh: 京都是值得一游的。

en: Kyoto gets thousands of visitors from all over the world each year.
zh: 京都每年接待来自世界各地的数千名游客。

en: Kyoto is not as large as Osaka.
zh: 京都没有大阪那么大。

en: Kyoto gets lots of visitors from all over the world.
zh: 京都每年接待来自世界各地的大量游客。

en: As science makes progress, old ways give place to new.
zh: 随着科学的进步，旧的方式让位于新的方式。

en: Chemistry gave us plastics.
zh: 化学为我们带来了塑料。

en: When science was less important than it is now, it was all very well to leave science to the scientists.
zh: 当科学不如现在重要时，把科学留给科学家们处理当然很好。

en: Science produced the atomic bomb.
zh: 科学制造了原子弹。

en: Science builds our lifestyle.
zh: 科学塑造了我们的生活方式。

en: My uncle's brother's son got involved in a shady business and disgraced the family.
zh: 我叔叔的兄弟的儿子卷入了一桩不正当的生意，给家族蒙羞。

en: Sleep and wait for good luck.
zh: 睡觉并等待好运。

en: A canal flowed between two rows of houses.
zh: 一条运河在两排房屋之间流淌。

en: My wife will be glad to see you, too.
zh: 我妻子也会很高兴见到你的。

en: My wife is preparing dinner right now.
zh: 我妻子现在正在准备晚餐。

en: My wife often rings me up, while she travels abroad.
zh: 我妻子出国旅行时经常给我打电话。

en: My wife is partial to apple pie.
zh: 我妻子特别喜欢苹果派。

en: I'm sick of listening to her complaints.
zh: 我厌倦了听她的抱怨。

en: My wife's part-time job brings in a little extra money.
zh: 我妻子的兼职工作带来了一些额外的收入。

en: There is no place like home.
zh: 金窝银窝不如自己的草窝。

en: You'll find domestic articles on the third floor.
zh: 您会在三楼找到家居用品。

en: Home life was being screened from foreign eyes.
zh: 家庭生活被屏蔽在外国人的视线之外。

en: My tutor scolded me for my stupid behavior.
zh: 我的导师因为我的愚蠢行为而责骂我。

en: The spirit of patriotism has its source in the love of the family.
zh: 爱国主义精神源于对家庭的爱。

en: I have peace at home.
zh: 我在家很安心。

en: Are you happy in your house?
zh: 你住在你的房子里幸福吗？

en: A lot of problems derive from a lack of reading in the home.
zh: 很多问题源于家庭中缺乏阅读。

en: We tend to use more and more electric appliances in the home.
zh: 我们倾向于在家里使用越来越多的电器。

en: Unable to pay the rent, I asked him for assistance.
zh: 由于无法支付租金，我向他寻求帮助。

en: The rent is due tomorrow.
zh: 租金明天到期。

en: I'll have exams right after the summer holidays.
zh: 暑假一结束我就要考试了。

en: Our plans for the summer are taking shape.
zh: 我们暑假的计划正在成形。

en: Do you have any plans for the summer vacation?
zh: 你暑假有什么计划吗？

en: During the summer vacation, I made friends with many villagers.
zh: 暑假期间，我和许多村民交了朋友。

en: I worked in a post office during the summer vacation.
zh: 暑假期间我在邮局工作。

en: How much money was saved in preparation for the summer vacation?
zh: 为准备暑假存了多少钱？

en: I delighted in going to his farm during the summer vacation.
zh: 暑假期间，我很高兴去他的农场。

en: Tourists poured into Karuizawa during the summer vacation.
zh: 暑假期间，游客涌入轻井泽。

en: I'm going away for the summer holiday.
zh: 我要出去度暑假。

en: I'm just going to rest during the summer vacation.
zh: 我只是打算在暑假期间休息。

en: Many young people go abroad during summer vacation.
zh: 暑假期间，许多年轻人出国。

en: I'm looking forward to your visit during summer vacation.
zh: 我期待着你在暑假期间的来访。

en: Because it was summer vacation, I took a trip.
zh: 因为是暑假，所以我去旅行了。

en: There is nothing like summer and ice cream.
zh: 夏天和冰淇淋是绝配。

en: The summer vacation is over.
zh: 暑假结束了。

en: How soon the summer holiday is over.
zh: 暑假过得真快啊。

en: I look forward to the summer vacation.
zh: 我期待着暑假。

en: The extension of the summer vacation delighted the children.
zh: 延长暑假让孩子们很高兴。

en: I like cold potato salad in the summertime.
zh: 我喜欢夏天的凉拌土豆沙拉。

en: As the summer has come, so it will go.
zh: 夏天来了，也会过去。

en: In summer meat easily goes bad; you must keep it in the refrigerator.
zh: 夏天肉容易变质，你必须把它放在冰箱里。

en: The summer had gone before I knew.
zh: 夏天在我不知不觉中过去了。

en: Summer is gone.
zh: 夏天过去了。

en: Do you like summer?
zh: 你喜欢夏天吗？

en: Summer is the season I like best.
zh: 夏天是我最喜欢的季节。

en: Smoking or non-smoking?
zh: 吸烟区还是非吸烟区？

en: Is there a place I can smoke?
zh: 请问哪里可以吸烟？

en: Could we have a table in the smoking section?
zh: 我们可以在吸烟区要一张桌子吗？

en: Smokers are far more likely to develop lung cancer than non-smokers are.
zh: 吸烟者比不吸烟者更容易患肺癌。

en: If people who smoke are deprived of their cigarettes, they get nervous and irritable.
zh: 如果吸烟者没有烟抽，他们会变得紧张和烦躁。

en: Smokers take twice as many days off sick as non-smokers.
zh: 吸烟者请病假的天数是不吸烟者的两倍。

en: Being in a room full of smokers is my pet peeve.
zh: 在一个满是吸烟者的房间里是我最讨厌的事情。

en: I gave up smoking and I feel like a new man.
zh: 我戒烟了，感觉像换了一个人。

en: The doctor told me to give up smoking.
zh: 医生告诉我戒烟。

en: Please refrain from smoking.
zh: 请勿吸烟。

en: Smoking will do more harm than good.
zh: 吸烟弊大于利。

en: You must give up smoking, as it is unhealthy.
zh: 你必须戒烟，因为它不健康。

en: Smoking may be harmful to his heart.
zh: 吸烟可能对他的心脏有害。

en: Smoking has an ill effect upon health.
zh: 吸烟对健康有不良影响。

en: It is said that smoking is bad for your health.
zh: 据说吸烟对你的健康有害。

en: Smoking is strictly prohibited.
zh: 严禁吸烟。

en: Smoking means suicide.
zh: 吸烟等于自杀。

en: Smoking is now banned on all domestic plane flights.
zh: 现在所有国内航班都禁止吸烟。

en: Smoking is harmful to health.
zh: 吸烟有害健康。

en: Smoking affects your health.
zh: 吸烟影响你的健康。

en: Smoking affects our health.
zh: 吸烟影响我们的健康。

en: Don't forget the fact that smoking is bad for your health.
zh: 别忘了吸烟对你的健康有害。

en: Smoking is bad for the health.
zh: 吸烟对健康有害。

en: Smoking is a danger to your health.
zh: 吸烟对你的健康是一种危害。

en: Smoking will do you a lot of harm.
zh: 吸烟会对你造成很大的伤害。

en: The students gathered at the call of the principal.
zh: 学生们应校长的召唤聚集在一起。

en: The students noted the professor's main points.
zh: 学生们记下了教授的要点。

en: Students are open to the influence of their teachers.
zh: 学生们容易受到老师的影响。

en: The students are making good progress in English.
zh: 学生们的英语正在取得良好的进展。

en: The students cheered in honor of Dr. Baker's birthday.
zh: 学生们欢呼庆祝贝克博士的生日。

en: The students stood waiting for a bus.
zh: 学生们站着等公共汽车。

en: None of the students have arrived on time.
zh: 没有一个学生准时到达。

en: I don't think any more students want to come.
zh: 我想没有更多的学生想来了。

en: Not all the students were present at the class.
zh: 并非所有学生都出席了课堂。

en: There was no objection on the part of the students.
zh: 学生方面没有任何反对意见。

en: This is a store that caters specially to students.
zh: 这是一家专门为学生服务的商店。

en: All the students recognized her as their representative.
zh: 所有学生都承认她是他们的代表。

en: All of the students were present.
zh: 所有学生都到场了。

en: All the students will partake in the play.
zh: 所有学生都将参加演出。

en: It is absurd to idle away the student life.
zh: 虚度学生生涯是荒谬的。

en: In his school days he wasn't as gentle as he is now.
zh: 他在学生时代不像现在这么温和。

en: He was far from clever in his school days.
zh: 他在学生时代远非聪明。

en: I was keen on classical music in my school days.
zh: 我在学生时代对古典音乐很感兴趣。

en: I got to know him when I was a student.
zh: 我当学生的时候认识了他。

en: It was an advantage having learned Chinese while I was in school.
zh: 在学校学习中文是一个优势。

en: I regret having been idle in my school days.
zh: 我后悔在学生时代虚度光阴。

en: I used to go fishing in my school days.
zh: 我过去在学生时代经常去钓鱼。

en: Read as many books as you can while you are a student.
zh: 趁你还是学生，尽可能多读书。

en: John would often go mountain climbing when he was a student.
zh: 约翰当学生的时候经常去爬山。

en: I studied in England for six months when I was a student.
zh: 我当学生的时候在英国学习了六个月。

en: Had I known your telephone number, I would have called you.
zh: 早知道你的电话号码，我就给你打电话了。

en: May I use your phone?
zh: 我可以用一下你的电话吗？

en: Your suggestion came up at the meeting.
zh: 在会议上提出了你的建议。

en: His proposal is out of the question.
zh: 他的提议是不可能的。

en: Your suggestion amounts to an order.
zh: 你的建议实际上就是命令。

en: Your suggestion will be rejected by the teacher.
zh: 你的建议会被老师拒绝的。

en: Your proposal is a bit extreme.
zh: 你的提议有点极端。

en: Your suggestion is of no practical use.
zh: 你的建议没有实际用处。

en: I can't agree to your proposal on the ground that it is not fair and reasonable.
zh: 我不能同意你的提议，因为它不公平也不合理。

en: I am in favor of your proposal.
zh: 我赞成你的提议。

en: I cannot agree to your proposal.
zh: 我不能同意你的提议。

en: There is certain to be some opposition to your suggestion.
zh: 你的建议肯定会遭到一些反对。

en: I don't mean to object to your proposal.
zh: 我不是故意要反对你的提议。

en: Bring your brother with you.
zh: 带上你的兄弟一起来。

en: Is there no alternative to what you propose?
zh: 你提出的方案没有其他替代方案了吗？

en: Your brother said you'd gone to Paris.
zh: 你兄弟说你去了巴黎。

en: You'll be paid according to the amount of work you do.
zh: 你会根据你的工作量获得报酬。

en: How many schools are there in your city?
zh: 你们城市有多少所学校？

en: Can I count on your loyalty?
zh: 我可以指望你的忠诚吗？

en: I'll act on your advice.
zh: 我会按照你的建议行事。

en: If only I had taken your advice.
zh: 要是我听了你的劝告就好了。

en: If it were not for your advice, I would be at a loss.
zh: 要不是你的建议，我真不知所措。

en: Without your advice, I would have been robbed of my bag.
zh: 如果没有你的建议，我的包就被抢了。

en: If it had not been for your advice, I would have failed.
zh: 要不是你的建议，我就失败了。

en: Your idea leaves nothing to be desired.
zh: 你的想法完美无缺。

en: If it were to rain tomorrow, the match would be postponed.
zh: 如果明天下雨，比赛就会延期。

en: If you were to win the lottery, what would you buy with the money?
zh: 如果你中了彩票，你会用这笔钱买什么？

en: Were the earth to stop revolving, what do you suppose would happen?
zh: 如果地球停止转动，你认为会发生什么？

en: If the sun were to rise in the west, I wouldn't change my mind.
zh: 如果太阳从西边升起，我也不会改变我的想法。

en: What would you do if war were to break out?
zh: 如果爆发战争，你会怎么做？

en: If I were to be born again, I would be a musician.
zh: 如果我能再次出生，我想成为一名音乐家。

en: If I were to tell you the truth, you would be surprised.
zh: 如果我告诉你真相，你会很惊讶。

en: If I should be late getting home, please don't wait up for me.
zh: 如果我回家晚了，请不要等我。

en: If we were to live on the moon, how large would the earth look?
zh: 如果我们住在月球上，地球看起来会有多大？

en: Were I to die, who would look after my children?
zh: 如果我死了，谁会照顾我的孩子？

en: If I were you, I would go home and take a good rest.
zh: 如果我是你，我会回家好好休息。

en: Even if I grant that what you say is true, it is no excuse.

en: Granted that you are right, we still have to persuade him first.
zh: 就算你是对的，我们仍然需要先说服他。

en: If I were to go abroad, I would go to France.

en: If he wants to succeed at all, he must work harder.

en: Whatever is worth doing at all, is worth doing well.

zh: 如果我告诉你全部真相，你会感到震惊。

en: If UFOs were to attack the earth, what would become of us?
zh: 如果不明飞行物攻击地球，我们会怎么样？

en: Fossil fuels won't be available forever.

en: I got a rash from cosmetics.

en: Chemical products account for approximately two-thirds of our exports.

en: Chemical companies are waiting until everything dies down before reinvesting.
zh: 化工公司正在等待一切平静下来后再进行再投资。

en: Your motive was admirable, but your action was not.

en: Check your answers with his.
zh: 把你的答案和他核对一下。

en: Check your answer with his.
zh: 把你的答案和他核对一下。

en: Compare your answers with the teacher's.

en: Your answer is to the point.

en: Your answer isn't correct. Try again.

en: Your answer is right.

en: Your answer is anything but perfect.

en: Your answer is wrong.

en: Your answer is far from perfect.

en: Your answer is far from satisfactory.

en: If your answer is correct, it follows that mine is wrong.
zh: 如果你的答案是正确的，那就意味着我的答案是错误的。

en: I think your answer is correct.

en: It doesn't matter whether your answer is right or wrong.

en: Your efforts will soon pay off.
zh: 你的努力很快就会得到回报。

en: I'm sure your efforts will result in success.
zh: 我确信你的努力会带来成功。

en: Your efforts will pay off one day.
zh: 你的努力总有一天会得到回报。

en: Your efforts will bear fruit someday.
zh: 你的努力总有一天会结出果实。

en: Your effort will be rewarded in the long run.
zh: 你的努力最终会得到回报。

en: Your efforts will be rewarded in the long run.
zh: 你的努力最终会得到回报。

en: I hope your efforts will bear fruit.
zh: 我希望你的努力能结出果实。

en: Come and see me when it is convenient for you.
zh: 你方便的时候就来找我。

en: You can come and see me whenever it's convenient for you.
zh: 你什么时候方便就什么时候来找我。

en: I forget your telephone number.

en: I am very glad school is over.
zh: 我很高兴放学了。

en: School being over, we went swimming in the pool.
zh: 放学后，我们去游泳池游泳了。

en: You must be hungry after school is over.
zh: 放学后你一定饿了吧。

en: The school provided us with textbooks.

en: The month when school begins is April.
zh: 学校开学的月份是四月。

en: School has started and I like it so far.
zh: 开学了，到目前为止我都很喜欢。

en: The school will provide tents for us.

en: Some go in groups organized by their schools, but most go in twos and threes.
zh: 有些人以学校为单位组队前往，但大多数人是两三个一起去。

en: On my way home from school, I was caught in a shower and got wet to the skin.
zh: 我放学回家的路上，突然下起了大雨，淋了个透。

en: When she returned home from school, she began to help her mother in the kitchen.
zh: 她放学回家后，就开始帮妈妈在厨房做饭。

en: I have just come back from school.

zh: 我放学回家的路上淋了雨，浑身湿透，还感冒了。

en: When she saw that they had no schools, she started one.
zh: 当她看到他们没有学校时，她就办了一所。

en: I was also impressed with the school's cleanliness and the students' pride in it.
zh: 学校的整洁和学生们的自豪感也给我留下了深刻的印象。

en: It is silly of you to neglect your studies.

en: They helped one another to make the school festival a success.
zh: 他们互相帮助，使学校的节日取得了成功。

en: Our campus festival is to be held next week.
zh: 我们的校园节将于下周举行。

en: Learning without thought is labor lost.

en: The more you learn, the more you want to.
zh: 你学的越多，就越想学。

en: The more we learn, the better we realize our ignorance.
zh: 我们学得越多，就越意识到自己的无知。

en: The more you study, the more you discover your ignorance.
zh: 你学得越多，就越发现自己的无知。

en: Now that you're grown up, you must not behave like that.
zh: 你都这么大了，不能再那样做了。

en: Now that you are grown-up, you ought to know better.
zh: 你都这么大了，应该懂事了。

en: Now that you are grown up, you must not behave like a child.
zh: 你都这么大了，不能再像个小孩子一样了。

en: You are now an adult.

en: Now that you have come of age, you should know better.

en: Now that you have come of age, you should be responsible for what you do.

en: Now you've come of age, you have the right to vote.
zh: 你已经成年了，有选举权了。

en: You must go to bed now.

en: You had better go to bed now.

en: You should have come a little earlier.

en: You must get up a little earlier.

en: You nearly poked me in the eye with your pencil.

en: You must be less impatient.

en: You had better stay here a little longer.

en: Have you finished doing your homework yet?

en: Now that you have passed your test, you can drive on your own.

en: You are not a child any more.

en: You may go home now.

en: It is time you went to school.

en: Have you turned in your report?

en: It's high time you got going.

en: Have you finished reading that book yet?

en: You are old enough to know this.

en: I will be glad to help you.

en: I'm glad you enjoyed it.

en: I'd be happy to attend your party.

en: I will be pleased to help you.

en: I am only too pleased to come with you.

en: Joy was mingled with sorrow.

en: Short pleasure, long repentance.

en: Tears of joy rained down their cheeks.

en: Delight is the opposite of sorrow.

en: It is easier to sympathize with sorrow than to sympathize with joy.

en: Her face was animated by joy.

en: His joy showed on his face.

en: All of the rules must be in line with company policy.

en: The rules must be few, and what is more important, simple.

en: The rules must be few, and more importantly, simple.
zh: 规则必须少，更重要的是，要简单。

en: Rules are to be observed.

en: We must observe the rules.

zh: 一声汽笛响了，船慢慢地开始驶离港口。

en: The steamer is now out of sight.

en: Line up the desks in the classroom.

en: I wish our classroom were air-conditioned.

en: You must not make noises in the classroom.

en: Do you eat it in the classroom?

en: Don't you talk in the classroom.

en: Get out of the classroom.

en: The teachers are trying to motivate their students.

en: The teacher is likely to get angry with the students.

en: The teacher often emphasizes that students should have courage.

en: The teacher exhorted his pupils to do well.
zh: 老师劝诫他的学生们要好好学习。

en: The teacher caught the student cheating on the examination.

en: Teachers shouldn't fall back on their authority.

en: Teachers should give their children the faith that tomorrow will be brighter and happier.
zh: 老师应该给孩子们相信明天会更光明更幸福的信念。

en: You'd better have your hair cut at once.
zh: 你最好马上去理发。

en: You may as well go to bed at once.

en: You may go at once.

en: You'd better set off at once.

en: You'll get well soon.

en: You've got it in one. That's right.

en: You will soon get accustomed to living here.

en: It is necessary for you to start at once.

en: You had better start at once.

en: You will soon be convinced I am right.

en: You may as well begin at once.

en: You will soon get accustomed to your new school.

en: You are to give up smoking at once.

en: You are to do it at once.

en: You will soon come to like this town.

en: You'd better go to see your family doctor at once.

en: You ought to do it at once.

en: You may as well wash your shirt.

en: You're forever making mistakes.

en: You can stay with us for the time being.

en: What are you staring at?

en: You will soon regret your rash conduct.

en: You must adapt to a variety of conditions.

en: You may have mistaken Jane for his sister.

en: You'd better stay at home rather than go out on such a day.

en: I know your name.

en: Didn't you hear your name called?

en: Your daughter is not a child anymore.

en: I admire your ignorance.

en: The time will come when your dream will come true.

en: You have a regular pulse.

en: Tell me about your program for the future.

en: Your comic books are on the shelf.

en: How pretty your sister is!

en: What's your real purpose?

en: Your book is double the size of mine.

en: Your book is on the desk.

en: I will be your guarantor.

en: Better to get advice from your lawyer.

en: I am sick of your complaint.

en: Your allotment is $20.

en: Since I got a raise, I can manage.

en: This is a better way of paying people, according to Paula Grayson.
zh: 根据保拉·格雷森的说法，这是一种更好的支付工资的方式。

en: The income tax rate increases in proportion as your salary rises.
zh: 所得税税率随着你的工资上涨而增加。

en: Do you have a school lunch at school?
zh: 你在学校吃学校午餐吗？

en: The printer needs paper.
zh: 打印机需要纸。

en: The waiter brought a new plate.
zh: 服务员端来了一个新盘子。

en: Waiter, please bring me some water.
zh: 服务员，请给我拿些水。

en: On behalf of my classmates, let me say a few words of thanks to you.
zh: 我谨代表我的同学们，向您致以几句感谢的话。

en: The classmates felt for him deeply.
zh: 同学们深深地同情他。

en: His classmates' jeers reduced him to tears.
zh: 他同学们的嘲笑让他泪流满面。

en: Some of the classmates passed the examination, but the others didn't.
zh: 一些同学通过了考试，但其他的没有。

en: He will wriggle out of the fix.
zh: 他会摆脱困境的。

en: A cornered rat will bite a cat.
zh: 狗急跳墙。

en: Necessity is the mother of invention.
zh: 需要是发明之母。

en: Ultimately, space flight will be beneficial to all mankind.
zh: 最终，太空飞行将有益于全人类。

en: The stadium was quite still.
zh: 体育场非常安静。

en: There were a lot of people in the stadium.
zh: 体育场里有很多人。

en: The ball rolled into the stream.
zh: 球滚进了小溪里。

en: The ball slightly curved.
zh: 球稍微弯曲了一下。

en: The ball bounced over the wall.
zh: 球弹过了墙。

en: One third of the earth's surface is desert.
zh: 地球表面的三分之一是沙漠。

en: Crying is an expression of grief.
zh: 哭泣是悲伤的表达。

en: It's not worth crying over.
zh: 不值得为它哭泣。

en: To weep is to make less the depth of grief.
zh: 哭泣可以减轻悲伤的深度。

en: Misfortunes never come singly.
zh: 祸不单行。

en: The watch you gave me doesn't keep time.
zh: 你送我的手表不准了。

en: I had no notion that you were coming.
zh: 我一点也不知道你要来。

en: My life would be completely empty without you.
zh: 我的生活如果没有你，将会完全空虚。

en: You'll be missed by your friends.
zh: 你的朋友们会想念你的。

en: We shall all miss you when you go away.
zh: 你离开后，我们都会想念你的。

en: I miss you badly.
zh: 我非常想你。

en: How I miss you.
zh: 我多么想你啊。

en: I miss you very much.
zh: 我非常想你。

en: We all miss you very much.
zh: 我们大家都非常想你。

en: We will miss you badly.
zh: 我们会非常想念你的。

en: Whenever you come, I'm ready.
zh: 无论你什么时候来，我都准备好了。

en: It is because you work too much that you are sleepy all the time.
zh: 你总是犯困是因为你工作太努力了。

en: Why is it that you are always late?
zh: 你为什么总是迟到？

en: You may stay here as long as you like.
zh: 你想在这里待多久都可以。

en: You can talk until you're blue in the face, but you'll never convince me.
zh: 就算你说破嘴，你也说服不了我。

en: Laugh as much as you like; I'll stick to my plan to the bitter end.
zh: 你随便笑吧，我还是会坚持我的计划到底。

en: I cannot endure your going.
zh: 我无法忍受你的离去。

en: You walk too fast for me to keep up with you.
zh: 你走得太快了，我跟不上你。

en: If only you had told me the whole story at that time!
zh: 要是你当时把整个故事都告诉我该多好啊！

en: It is impossible for you to jump two meters high.
zh: 你不可能跳过两米高。

en: We think it is very dangerous that you're climbing the mountain alone.
zh: 我们认为你独自爬山非常危险。

en: Here is a letter for you.
zh: 这是给你的信。

en: Are you saying that our plan was accepted? I hope you're not showing me any premature happiness here.
zh: 你是说我们的计划被接受了吗？我希望你不是在让我空欢喜一场。

en: You, be quiet!
zh: 你，安静点！

en: Have you ever seen Mt. Fuji? It is beautiful beyond description.
zh: 你见过富士山吗？它美得难以形容。

en: Work is preferable to idleness.
zh: 工作胜于无所事事。

en: Don't cry before you're hurt.
zh: 不要没受伤就哭。

en: You can wear my scarf as long as you don't spill anything on it.
zh: 你可以戴我的围巾，只要你别弄脏它。

en: Everything points to his guilt.
zh: 一切都指向他有罪。

en: Those who forget everything are happy.
zh: 那些什么都忘记的人是幸福的。

en: You had better tell me the whole story.
zh: 你最好把整个故事告诉我。

en: He looked as if he knew all about it.
zh: 他看起来好像对这件事了如指掌。

en: Sometimes everything goes wrong.
zh: 有时候一切都会出错。

en: Everything seemed to go wrong with me.
zh: 似乎我做什么都不顺。

en: Everything is now ready for you.
zh: 一切都为你准备好了。

en: You didn't leave me shit.
zh: 你什么都没给我留下。

en: Everything went better than I had expected.
zh: 一切都比我预期的要好。

en: No one shall be held in slavery.
zh: 任何人不得为奴隶。

en: Before everything you should take better care of your health.
zh: 在一切之前，你应该更好地照顾你的健康。

en: What were we talking about?
zh: 我们刚才在说什么？

en: What does this stand for?
zh: 这是什么意思？

en: It is good for nothing.
zh: 它一无是处。

en: For what purpose did he come here?
zh: 他来这里是为了什么目的？

en: Few people are free of care.
zh: 很少有人没有烦恼。

en: What do I have?
zh: 我有什么？

en: What thought do you think had the biggest impact on the English in the Middle Ages?
zh: 你认为哪个想法对中世纪的英国人影响最大？

en: By what authority do you order me to do this?
zh: 你凭什么命令我做这件事？

en: Who are you to tell me to get out?
zh: 你凭什么叫我滚出去？

en: What flower do you like best?
zh: 你最喜欢什么花？

en: Never hesitate to tell the truth.
zh: 永远不要犹豫说出真相。

en: I like the way you smile.
zh: 我喜欢你微笑的样子。

en: Let's have a serious talk about your future.
zh: 我们来认真谈谈你的未来。

en: I hope you have a happy future ahead of you.
zh: 我希望你有一个幸福的未来。

en: Your advice has helped me see the light regarding my future.
zh: 你的建议帮助我看到了我未来的光明。

en: Your advice is always helpful to me.
zh: 你的建议总是对我有帮助。

en: I expect your help.
zh: 我期待你的帮助。

en: I don't need your help.
zh: 我不需要你的帮助。

en: But for your help, I should have failed.
zh: 要不是你的帮助，我早就失败了。

en: Without your help, we wouldn't be able to carry out our plan.
zh: 没有你的帮助，我们无法执行我们的计划。

en: He is equal to the task.
zh: 他能胜任这项任务。

en: We'll start whenever you are ready.
zh: 你准备好的时候我们就开始。

en: We will exempt you from attending.
zh: 我们将免除你的出席。

en: When will your assignment be completed?
zh: 你的作业什么时候完成？

en: The ice will give under your weight.
zh: 冰承受不住你的重量。

en: Write your address here.
zh: 请在这里写下你的地址。

en: Your income is about twice as large as mine.
zh: 你的收入大约是我的两倍。

en: Your income is about twice as large as mine is.
zh: 你的收入大约是我的两倍。

en: Your income is three times larger than mine.
zh: 你的收入是我的三倍。

en: Your attendance at classes was irregular.
zh: 你上课的出勤率很不规律。

en: I'll miss your cooking.
zh: 我会想念你做的菜。

en: This happened prior to receiving your letter.
zh: 这件事发生在收到你的信之前。

en: I received your letter yesterday.
zh: 我昨天收到了你的信。

en: Your letter made me happy.
zh: 你的信让我很高兴。

en: What position do you hold?
zh: 你担任什么职位？

en: Are your hands clean?
zh: 你的手干净吗？

en: Yoke the oxen to the plow.
zh: 把牛套在犁上。

en: Cattle were grazing in the field.
zh: 牛在田里吃草。

en: Cows are eating grass in the meadow.
zh: 奶牛在草地上吃草。

en: The cows are eating grass.
zh: 奶牛在吃草。

en: I ran into an old friend.
zh: 我碰到了一个老朋友。

en: Meeting my old friend was very pleasant.
zh: 遇到我的老朋友非常愉快。

en: Old friends called on me.
zh: 老朋友来看我了。

en: My old friend dropped in at my house.
zh: 我的老朋友顺便来我家拜访。

en: My old friend wrote to me, informing me of his return from abroad.
zh: 我的老朋友写信告诉我他从国外回来了。

en: Old friends were invited to the reception.
zh: 老朋友被邀请参加招待会。

en: I've used up my wages, but I have my bank account to fall back on.
zh: 我的工资用完了，但我还有银行存款可以依靠。

en: As soon as I get paid I will pay you back.
zh: 我一拿到工资就会还你。

en: I received a five hundred dollar advance on my pay.
zh: 我收到了五百美元的预支工资。

en: Wages vary in relation to the age of the worker.
zh: 工资因工人的年龄而异。

en: The salary is fixed according to age and experience.
zh: 工资是根据年龄和经验确定的。

en: The wages will be paid in proportion to the work done.
zh: 工资将按完成的工作量支付。

en: You will be paid according to your ability.
zh: 你的工资将根据你的能力支付。

en: Pay will be based on experience and educational background.
zh: 工资将根据经验和教育背景而定。

en: Can I get an advance on my salary?
zh: 我可以预支工资吗？

en: In terms of salary, that job is fantastic.
zh: 就工资而言，那份工作太棒了。

en: Aside from his salary, he receives money from investments.
zh: 除了工资，他还从投资中获得收入。

en: It's a good job, as far as the pay goes.
zh: 就工资而言，这是一份好工作。

en: He is not better off because he is poorly paid.
zh: 他过得并不好，因为他的工资很低。

en: His low salary prevents him from buying the house.
zh: 他微薄的工资使他无法买房。

en: You should not despise a man because he is poorly paid.
zh: 你不应该因为一个人工资低而鄙视他。

en: Whatever we may undertake, diligence is important.
zh: 无论我们做什么，勤奋都很重要。

en: Everything eventually gets easier with practice.
zh: 熟能生巧，一切最终都会变得更容易。

en: Nothing is as precious as friendship.
zh: 没有什么比友谊更珍贵。

en: Nothing can prevent her from marrying him.
zh: 没有什么能阻止她嫁给他。

en: Nothing can be gained without effort.
zh: 不劳无获。

en: Resignation is the first lesson of life.
zh: 顺从是人生的第一课。

en: Don't do anything by halves.
zh: 不要半途而废。

en: You cannot have your way in everything.
zh: 你不可能事事如愿。

en: Whatever you're doing, starting off on the right foot is essential.
zh: 无论你做什么，好的开始至关重要。

en: He smoked as if nothing had happened.
zh: 他抽烟的样子好像什么都没发生过。

en: Nothing happened.
zh: 什么都没发生。

en: All things must have an end.
zh: 天下没有不散的筵席。

en: Don't carry anything to excess.
zh: 凡事不要过度。

en: Moderation in all things.
zh: 凡事适度。

en: Try to have a positive attitude about everything.
zh: 尝试对一切事物保持积极的态度。

en: Take a mean position in everything.
zh: 凡事采取折衷的立场。

en: Do your best in everything.
zh: 尽你所能做好每一件事。

en: One has to do one's best in anything.
zh: 人必须尽力做好任何事。

en: You should do your best in everything.
zh: 你应该尽你所能做好每一件事。

en: Keep in mind that there's no royal road to anything.
zh: 记住，世上没有通往任何事物的捷径。

en: Try your best in everything.
zh: 尽你最大的努力去做每一件事。

en: You must not go to extremes in anything.
zh: 你做任何事都不能走极端。

en: Be the matter what it may, we must persevere.
zh: 无论事情如何，我们都必须坚持下去。

en: Whatever may happen.
zh: 无论发生什么事。

en: Should anything arise, she will be prepared for it.
zh: 如果发生什么事，她会做好准备的。

en: School will soon break up for the summer vacation.
zh: 学校快要放暑假了。

en: The school drains the pool once a month.
zh: 学校每月给游泳池排水一次。

en: Where do you go to school?
zh: 你在哪里上学？

en: The school is only five minutes' walk from here.
zh: 学校离这儿只有五分钟的步行路程。

en: School has closed for the Christmas holidays.
zh: 学校已经放圣诞节假了。

en: The school stands about one mile off.
zh: 学校大约在离这里一英里的地方。

en: The school is across from our house.
zh: 学校就在我们家对面。

en: When is school over?
zh: 什么时候放学？

en: When does your school break up?
zh: 你们学校什么时候放假？

en: When does school break up?
zh: 什么时候放假？

en: Does school start at eight-thirty?
zh: 学校八点半开始上课吗？

en: School begins at nine and is over at six.
zh: 学校九点开始，六点结束。

en: School begins at eight-thirty.
zh: 学校八点半开始上课。

en: Our school begins at eight.
zh: 我们学校八点开始上课。

en: The school is two kilometers ahead.
zh: 学校在前方两公里处。

en: School begins on April 8.
zh: 学校4月8日开学。

en: He excels all his brothers in scholastic ability.
zh: 他的学习能力超过了他所有的兄弟。

en: The school grounds extend as far as this fence.
zh: 学校的场地延伸到这个栅栏。

en: The school gymnasium was enlarged.
zh: 学校的体育馆扩建了。

en: Don't tell tales out of school.
zh: 不要在外面说学校里的事。

en: We celebrated the centenary anniversary day.
zh: 我们庆祝了百年校庆。

en: You see some trees in front of the school.
zh: 你看到学校前面有一些树。

en: School children have colds twice as often as adults.
zh: 小学生感冒的次数是成人的两倍。

en: My school grades were average.
zh: 我的学校成绩一般。

en: A poor school record will count against you when you look for a job.
zh: 糟糕的学校记录会在你找工作时对你不利。

en: We walked as far as the park.
zh: 我们一直走到公园。

en: We sat on a bench in the park.
zh: 我们坐在公园的长椅上。

en: We must observe the traffic regulations.
zh: 我们必须遵守交通规则。

en: We got involved in a traffic accident.
zh: 我们卷入了一场交通事故。

en: We were deprived of transportation.
zh: 我们失去了交通工具。

en: We took turns with the driving.
zh: 我们轮流开车。

en: We took turns driving the car.
zh: 我们轮流驾驶汽车。

en: We bargained that we should go on a five-day week.
zh: 我们商定实行每周五天工作制。

en: We left a margin for error in our estimates.
zh: 我们在估算中留出了误差幅度。

en: We made a bargain that we wouldn't forsake each other.
zh: 我们达成协议，永不抛弃彼此。

en: We will reap rich rewards later on in life.
zh: 我们将来会在生活中获得丰厚的回报。

en: We need to communicate with each other.
zh: 我们需要互相沟通。

en: We knocked at the door for five minutes, but in vain.
zh: 我们敲了五分钟的门，但毫无结果。

en: We made camp near the lake.
zh: 我们在湖边扎营。

en: We stood at the door to welcome our guests.
zh: 我们站在门口欢迎客人。

en: We discovered relics of an ancient civilization.
zh: 我们发现了古代文明的遗迹。

en: We had a rough crossing on an old ferry.
zh: 我们乘坐旧渡轮，经历了一次艰难的航行。

en: We express thought with language.
zh: 我们用语言表达思想。

en: We need action, not words.
zh: 我们需要行动，而不是空谈。

en: We communicate by means of language.
zh: 我们通过语言进行交流。

en: We found the front door locked.
zh: 我们发现前门锁着。

en: We import raw materials and export the finished products.
zh: 我们进口原材料，出口成品。

en: We have to reduce the cost to a minimum.
zh: 我们必须将成本降到最低。

en: We deal in silk goods.
zh: 我们经营丝绸制品。

en: We elaborated on our study plan.
zh: 我们详细阐述了我们的学习计划。

en: I cleared my throat, but no words came.
zh: 我清了清嗓子，但说不出话来。

en: Do you have any cough medicine?
zh: 你有止咳药吗？

en: You should buy some cough medicine and aspirin.
zh: 你应该买些止咳药和阿司匹林。

en: Do you have any coughing?
zh: 你咳嗽吗？

en: Cover your mouth when you cough, sneeze, or yawn.
zh: 咳嗽、打喷嚏或打哈欠时，请遮住你的嘴。

en: External application only.
zh: 仅供外用。

en: The foreign minister attended the talks.
zh: 外交部长出席了会谈。

en: Outside advice may be necessary.
zh: 可能需要外部建议。

en: External pressure grows ever more intense.
zh: 外部压力越来越大。

en: Save it on the external hard drive.
zh: 把它保存在移动硬盘上。

en: Can I sleep out?
zh: 我可以在外面睡觉吗？

en: The Foreign Minister said that war was inevitable.
zh: 外交部长说战争是不可避免的。

en: People shouldn't stare at foreigners.
zh: 人们不应该盯着外国人看。

en: Don't make fun of foreigners.
zh: 不要嘲笑外国人。

en: As is often the case with foreigners, John dislikes nattou.
zh: 和许多外国人一样，约翰不喜欢纳豆。

en: It is difficult for foreigners to get used to Japanese food.
zh: 外国人很难习惯日本食物。

en: See to it that the door is locked before you leave.
zh: 你走之前一定要把门锁好。

en: I don't feel like going out.
zh: 我不想出去。

en: I have to do my homework instead of going out.
zh: 我必须做作业，不能出去。

en: Don't forget to polish your shoes before you go out!
zh: 出门前别忘了擦亮你的鞋子！

en: Are you going to pull curfew on me?
zh: 你要限制我的外出时间吗？

en: It was careless of her to leave the door unlocked when she went out.
zh: 她出去时没锁门，真是粗心大意。

en: Comb your hair before you go out.
zh: 出门前梳梳头。

en: See to it that all the doors are locked before you go out.
zh: 出门前一定要把所有的门都锁好。

en: Make sure to turn off all the lights before going out.
zh: 出门前一定要关掉所有的灯。

en: You are my best friend.
zh: 你是我最好的朋友。

en: You like Kawaguchi.
zh: 你喜欢川口。

en: You like elephants.
zh: 你喜欢大象。

en: You have three cars.
zh: 你有三辆车。

en: Do you study chemistry?
zh: 你学习化学吗？

en: You drink tea.
zh: 你喝茶。

en: You study English.
zh: 你学习英语。

en: You are a doctor.
zh: 你是医生。

en: You like balls.
zh: 你喜欢球。

en: You are a tennis player.
zh: 你是网球运动员。

en: We'll leave as soon as you are ready.
zh: 你准备好了我们就走。

en: Let us know when you'll arrive.
zh: 你到了告诉我们一声。

en: Put your affairs in order.
zh: 安排好你的事务。

en: What's your shoe size?
zh: 你穿多大码的鞋？

en: Your shoes want mending.
zh: 你的鞋需要修补了。

en: I've been anxious to meet you.
zh: 我一直很想见到你。

en: What's your home address?
zh: 你家的地址是什么？

en: I have some appreciation of your problems.
zh: 我对你的问题有些了解。

en: She rushed to the office, and was ushered right into an examination room.
zh: 她匆匆赶到办公室，然后立刻被领进了一间检查室。

en: She was very shy about her emergency problem, and asked the gynecologist to please examine her.
zh: 她对她的紧急问题感到非常害羞，并请妇科医生为她检查。

en: Your tap water is too hard. Get a water softener.
zh: 你家的自来水太硬了。买个软水器吧。

en: You have tennis elbow. Soak your arm in warm water.
zh: 你得了网球肘。把你的胳膊泡在温水里。

en: Your daughter's on drugs.
zh: 你女儿在吸毒。

en: Your dog has worms. Give him vitamins.
zh: 你的狗有寄生虫。给它补充维生素。

en: Thank you again for your kind assistance.
zh: 再次感谢您的热心帮助。

en: It wasn't until I got home that I missed my umbrella.
zh: 直到我回到家才发现我把伞弄丢了。

en: I was half asleep when I went home.
zh: 我回家的时候半睡半醒。

en: When I came home, I felt very hungry.
zh: 我回到家的时候，感觉非常饿。

en: My advice is for you to go home.
zh: 我的建议是让你回家。

en: A surprise was in store for me at home.
zh: 在家里有一个惊喜等着我。

en: We spent a lot of money on furnishing our house.
zh: 我们花了很多钱来装修我们的房子。

en: There are more children's stories about the fear of being left home alone.
zh: 有很多儿童故事是关于害怕独自留在家里的。

en: There was much food in the house.
zh: 房子里有很多食物。

en: We have two television sets.
zh: 我们有两台电视机。

en: There are 5 computers in the house, but 2 of them aren't any use.
zh: 家里有5台电脑，但其中2台没用。

en: He is away from home.
zh: 他不在家。

en: Entering the house, I tripped over the mat.
zh: 走进房子，我被垫子绊倒了。

en: The house was blazing with lights.
zh: 房子灯火通明。

en: I left my card at home.
zh: 我把卡落在家里了。

en: I have spent a lot of money on my house.
zh: 我花了很多钱在我的房子上。

en: We have two dogs. One is black and the other is white.
zh: 我们有两只狗。一只是黑色的，另一只是白色的。

en: I prefer going out to staying at home.
zh: 我宁愿出去也不愿待在家里。

en: I'm just going to stay home.
zh: 我只想待在家里。

en: I'll fix you some coffee.
zh: 我给你煮杯咖啡吧。

en: I may as well go out than stay at home.
zh: 我宁愿出去也不愿待在家里。

en: Staying home isn't fun.
zh: 待在家里不好玩。

en: When I'm at home there's a lot of stuff to do; I don't even have time to watch TV.
zh: 当我在家的时候有很多事情要做；我甚至没有时间看电视。

en: I would rather stay at home.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里。

en: I'd rather stay at home.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里。

en: If you take your shoes off before coming into the house you won't bring in any dirt from your shoes.
zh: 如果你进屋前脱掉鞋子，你就不会把鞋子上的泥土带进来了。

en: Almost all the students like English.
zh: 几乎所有的学生都喜欢英语。

en: One student says the purge is still going on in China and terror is widespread.
zh: 一名学生说，在中国清洗还在继续，恐怖主义十分猖獗。

en: I often wrote to her when I was a student.
zh: 我当学生的时候经常给她写信。

en: Memories of my college days come to my mind.
zh: 大学时代的回忆涌上我的心头。

en: Two-thirds of the students came to the meeting.
zh: 三分之二的学生来参加了会议。

en: I asked the student what image he had of black people.
zh: 我问那个学生他对黑人有什么印象。

en: Admission to students only.
zh: 仅限学生入内。

en: Have students read such books as will make them think more.
zh: 让学生阅读那些能让他们更多思考的书籍。

en: Do you take in students?
zh: 你们招收学生吗？

en: You had better leave the students to find out for themselves.
zh: 你最好让学生们自己去发现。

en: If you are a student, behave as such.
zh: 如果你是学生，就要有学生的样子。

en: Students are expected to stay away from dubious places.
zh: 学生们应该远离可疑的地方。

en: The students chose her chairman.
zh: 学生们选她当主席。

en: His students adored him.
zh: 他的学生们都很崇拜他。

en: Students discussed the problem of brain death for a long time.
zh: 学生们长时间地讨论了脑死亡的问题。

en: The students learned many poems by heart.
zh: 学生们用心记住了许多诗歌。

en: The students noted down every word the teacher said.
zh: 学生们记下了老师说的每一个字。

en: The students grimaced at the teacher.
zh: 学生们对老师做了个鬼脸。

en: Students have been protesting against the government's decision.
zh: 学生们一直在抗议政府的决定。

en: The students sat still all the time.
zh: 学生们一直静静地坐着。

en: Students came of their own accord to help the villagers.
zh: 学生们自愿来帮助村民。

en: The students were ill at ease before the exam.
zh: 考试前学生们感到不安。

en: The students wanted us to help push the car.
zh: 学生们想让我们帮忙推车。

en: The students revolted against authority.
zh: 学生们反抗权威。

en: The students assisted the professor in the investigation.
zh: 学生们协助教授进行调查。

en: The bridge is designed to open in the middle.
zh: 这座桥的设计是中间可以打开。

en: The bridge is being repaired.
zh: 这座桥正在维修。

en: The bridge will be completed by the end of this year.
zh: 这座桥将在今年年底前完工。

en: The bridge couldn't sustain the force of the strong current and collapsed.
zh: 这座桥无法承受强劲水流的冲击力而坍塌了。

en: The bridge is open to traffic.
zh: 这座桥已经通车了。

en: The bridge is safe; you can drive across.
zh: 这座桥很安全，你可以开车通过。

en: The bridge is one mile above.
zh: 这座桥在一英里以上的地方。

en: The bridge had been built before that time.
zh: 那座桥在那之前就已经建好了。

en: There is a waterfall above the bridge.
zh: 桥的上方有一个瀑布。

en: I saw a boat above the bridge.
zh: 我在桥的上方看到一艘船。

en: Do you know the man standing on the bridge?
zh: 你认识站在桥上的那个人吗？

en: Don't cross a bridge till you come to it.
zh: 船到桥头自然直。

en: There is a cottage beyond the bridge.
zh: 桥的那边有一间小屋。

en: Bids were invited for building the bridge.
zh: 已经邀请投标建造这座桥。

en: There is a hut below the bridge.
zh: 桥的下面有一间小屋。

en: Don't cross your bridges before you come to them.
zh: 不要杞人忧天。

en: It was dark under the bridge.
zh: 桥下很黑。

en: Several bridges have been damaged or swept away.
zh: 几座桥梁已经损坏或被冲走。

en: A bridge gives access to the island.
zh: 一座桥可以通往该岛屿。

en: The bridge crashed under the pressure.
zh: 桥在压力下坍塌了。

en: With the bridge destroyed, there was nothing to do but swim.
zh: 桥被毁了，除了游泳别无他法。

en: In culture, they are on the same plane as savages.
zh: 在文化方面，他们和野蛮人处于同一水平。

en: As is often the case with educated people, he likes classical music better than jazz.
zh: 受过教育的人通常都是这样，他更喜欢古典音乐而不是爵士乐。

en: The fact that educated Americans in general no longer share understandable background knowledge is a chief cause of their inability to communicate effectively.
zh: 受过教育的美国人普遍不再拥有可以理解的背景知识，这一事实是他们无法有效沟通的主要原因。

en: Teaching is a profession of my own choosing.
zh: 教学是我自己选择的职业。

en: Have a good time.
zh: 玩得开心。

en: Are you enjoying it?
zh: 你觉得怎么样？

en: Time goes by quickly when you're having fun.
zh: 乐不思蜀。

en: Enjoy yourself!
zh: 玩得开心！

en: I'm looking forward to it.
zh: 我很期待。

en: Have fun, but don't get lost.
zh: 玩得开心，但别迷路了。

en: We enjoyed seeing the city, but we got a little tired.
zh: 我们很喜欢看这座城市，但我们有点累了。

en: Did you have a good time?
zh: 你玩得开心吗？

en: Did you enjoy yourself?
zh: 你玩得开心吗？

en: We are having a good time.
zh: 我们玩得很开心。

en: Singing merrily, they started for home.
zh: 他们快乐地唱着歌，开始回家了。

en: Let's have some fun.
zh: 我们找点乐子吧。

en: I hope you're having fun.
zh: 我希望你玩得开心。

en: Are you having a good time?
zh: 你玩得开心吗？

en: Enjoy your trip.
zh: 旅途愉快。

en: I wish you a pleasant voyage.
zh: 祝你旅途愉快。

en: I hope you had a nice trip.
zh: 希望你旅途愉快。

en: Thank you for the pleasant evening.
zh: 谢谢你带来的美好夜晚。

en: Sweet dreams, Timmy.
zh: 祝你做个好梦，提米。

en: Have a nice weekend.
zh: 祝你周末愉快。

en: Have a nice flight.
zh: 祝你飞行愉快。

en: Did you have a good weekend?
zh: 你周末过得好吗？

en: When you're enjoying yourself, the time seems to fly by.
zh: 当你玩得开心时，时间过得真快。

en: A pleasant trip to you!
zh: 祝你旅途愉快！

en: Have a nice vacation.
zh: 祝你假期愉快。

en: I'll phone you as soon as I get to the airport.
zh: 我一到机场就给你打电话。

en: Upon arriving at the airport, he said, "I'm glad I could come back."
zh: 一到机场，他说：“我很高兴能回来。”

en: Arriving at the airport, I called her up.
zh: 到达机场后，我给她打了电话。

en: I had a hard time getting to the airport.
zh: 我去机场很不容易。

en: I have to go to the airport to meet my family.
zh: 我得去机场接我的家人。

en: There were a great many people at the airport.
zh: 机场有很多人。

en: There were hundreds of taxis at the airport, all touting for business.
zh: 机场有数百辆出租车，都在招揽生意。

en: What time should I go to the airport?
zh: 我应该几点去机场？

en: Upon arriving at the airport, he made a phonecall to his wife.
zh: 一到机场，他就给妻子打了个电话。

en: Please pick me up at the airport at five.
zh: 请五点到机场接我。

en: We saw her off at the airport.
zh: 我们在机场为她送行。

en: The long wait at the airport was tedious.
zh: 在机场漫长的等待很无聊。

en: A time bomb went off in the airport killing thirteen people.
zh: 机场发生了一起定时炸弹爆炸事件，造成十三人死亡。

en: They shook hands when they met at the airport.
zh: 他们在机场见面时握了手。

en: Please tell me which railway line to use from the airport to downtown.
zh: 请告诉我从机场到市中心应该乘坐哪条铁路线。

en: How long does it take to your office from the airport?
zh: 从机场到你的办公室要多久？

en: Is there a shuttle bus between the hotel and airport?
zh: 酒店和机场之间有穿梭巴士吗？

en: How far is it from the airport to the hotel?
zh: 从机场到酒店有多远？

en: Is it possible to take a shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel?
zh: 是否可以乘坐从机场到酒店的穿梭巴士？

en: To live without air is impossible.
zh: 没有空气就无法生存。

en: Oxygen from the air dissolves in water.
zh: 空气中的氧气溶解在水中。

en: Tiny particles in the air can cause cancer.
zh: 空气中的微小颗粒会导致癌症。

en: Because of the problem of air pollution, the bicycle may some day replace the automobile.
zh: 由于空气污染问题，自行车可能有一天会取代汽车。

en: Air is a mixture of gases that we cannot see.
zh: 空气是我们看不见的气体混合物。

en: Air is invisible.
zh: 空气是无形的。

en: I didn't like it.
zh: 我不喜欢它。

en: She's asking how that's possible.
zh: 她在问怎么可能。

en: You're just running away from life's problems.
zh: 你只是在逃避生活中的问题。

en: If you look at the lyrics, they don't really mean much.
zh: 如果你看看歌词，它们实际上并没有什么意义。

en: There's a problem there that you don't see.
zh: 那里有一个你没看到的问题。

en: You can do it.
zh: 你可以做到。

en: My physics teacher doesn't care if I skip classes.
zh: 我物理老师不在乎我是否逃课。

en: I wish I could go to Japan.
zh: 我希望我能去日本。

en: I hate it when there are a lot of people.
zh: 我讨厌人很多的时候。

en: I have to go to bed.
zh: 我必须去睡觉了。

en: After that, I left, but then I realized that I forgot my backpack at their house.
zh: 在那之后，我离开了，但后来我意识到我把背包忘在他们家了。

en: I won't ask you anything else today.
zh: 我今天不会再问你任何问题了。

en: It may freeze next week.
zh: 下周可能会结冰。

en: Even though he apologized, I'm still furious.
zh: 即使他道歉了，我仍然很生气。

en: The police will get you to find the bullets.
zh: 警察会让你找到子弹的。

en: Thanks for having explained to me at last why people take me for an idiot.
zh: 谢谢你终于向我解释了为什么人们认为我是个白痴。

en: That wasn't my intention.
zh: 那不是我的本意。

en: Thanks for your explanation.
zh: 谢谢你的解释。

en: Theoretically, I'm doing math.
zh: 理论上，我在做数学。

en: It almost scared me not to see you online for a whole day.
zh: 一整天没看到你在线，差点吓到我了。

en: I don't know what you mean.
zh: 我不明白你的意思。

en: My computer has got to be useful for something.
zh: 我的电脑总得有点用处吧。

en: You wanted to tell me about freedom?
zh: 你想告诉我关于自由的事？

en: Uh, now it's really weird...
zh: 呃，现在真的很奇怪...

en: One can't expect everything from schools.
zh: 人们不能指望学校能做到一切。

en: To be surprised, to wonder, is to begin to understand.
zh: 感到惊讶，感到疑惑，是理解的开始。

en: But the universe is infinite.
zh: 但是宇宙是无限的。

en: To be perfect she lacked just one defect.
zh: 要达到完美，她只差一个缺点。

en: And yet, the contrary is always true as well.
zh: 然而，相反的情况也总是成立的。

en: We don't see things as they are, but as we are.
zh: 我们看到的不是事物本来的样子，而是我们自己的样子。

en: The world is a den of crazies.
zh: 这世界是个疯人院。

en: You found me where no one else was looking.
zh: 你在别人找不到我的地方找到了我。

en: You're by my side; everything's fine now.
zh: 你在我身边，现在一切都好。

en: What do you mean you don't know?!
zh: 你说你不知道是什么意思？！

en: You look stupid.
zh: 你看上去很蠢。

en: I think I'm gonna go to sleep.
zh: 我想我要去睡觉了。

en: My name is Jack.
zh: 我叫杰克。

en: I like it very much.
zh: 我非常喜欢它。

en: We're meeting up tomorrow?
zh: 我们明天见面吗？

en: How do you say that in Italian?
zh: 这个用意大利语怎么说？

en: I have to go shopping. I'll be back in an hour.
zh: 我要去购物。我一个小时后回来。

en: Is it far from here?
zh: 离这里远吗？

en: These things aren't mine!
zh: 这些东西不是我的！

en: Thanks, that's all.
zh: 谢谢，就这些了。

en: Would you like to dance with me?
zh: 你愿意和我跳舞吗？

en: Italy is a very beautiful country.
zh: 意大利是一个非常美丽的国家。

en: It's not my fault!
zh: 这不是我的错！

en: I'd like to stay for one night.
zh: 我想住一晚。

en: Could you dial for me? The telephone is too high.
zh: 你能帮我拨号吗？电话太高了。

en: Is there a youth hostel near here?
zh: 这附近有青年旅社吗？

en: Environmental changes gave rise to new species.
zh: 环境变化孕育了新的物种。

en: Teach me some kanji, please.
zh: 请教我一些汉字。

en: Almost no students get full marks in Chinese classics.
zh: 几乎没有学生在中国古典文学中得满分。

en: Sweat is dripping from his face.
zh: 汗水从他的脸上滴下来。

en: Kanji are difficult to read.
zh: 汉字很难读。

en: I felt the sweat trickle down my brow.
zh: 我感到汗水从我的额头上滴下来。

en: I'm dripping with sweat.
zh: 我浑身是汗。

en: The shouting echoes loud.
zh: 喊声响亮地回荡。

en: We cheered him and chose him as our captain.
zh: 我们欢呼雀跃，并选他为我们的队长。

en: Shouts of joy burst forth.
zh: 欢呼声爆发出来。

en: The cheers swelled to a roar.
zh: 欢呼声越来越响。

en: Familiarity breeds contempt.
zh: 熟悉生轻蔑。

en: I like it better now that I'm used to it.
zh: 我现在更喜欢它了，因为我已经习惯了。

en: So great was his emotion that he could not utter a word.
zh: 他的情绪非常激动，以至于他说不出话来。

en: I was moved to tears.
zh: 我感动得流下了眼泪。

en: Can other people catch it?
zh: 其他人会感染吗？

en: I don't want to let my emotions out.
zh: 我不想表露我的情绪。

en: The bill was paid in coin.
zh: 账单是用硬币支付的。

en: Have a nice Thanksgiving!
zh: 感恩节快乐！

en: If we let our reasoning power be overshadowed by our emotions, we would be barking up the wrong tree all the time.
zh: 如果我们让我们的推理能力被我们的情绪所掩盖，我们就会一直白费力气。

en: Happy Thanksgiving Day.
zh: 感恩节快乐。

en: I can't think of the right words with which to express my thanks.
zh: 我一时想不出合适的词语来表达我的感谢。

en: I'd like to express my gratitude.
zh: 我想表达我的感激之情。

en: I don't know how to express my thanks.
zh: 我不知道如何表达我的感谢。

en: May I present this to you in token of my appreciation?
zh: 我可以把这个送给你作为我的感谢吗？

en: You are the only man in the world that I can call my friend.
zh: 你是我在这个世界上唯一能称之为朋友的人。

en: It is better for you to do it now.
zh: 你最好现在就做。

en: You made the mistake on purpose, didn't you?
zh: 你是故意犯这个错误的，对吧？

en: You had better set some money apart for your wedding.
zh: 你最好存点钱为你的婚礼做准备。

en: You only started this job an hour ago.
zh: 你才开始这份工作一个小时。

en: Which party do you belong to?
zh: 你属于哪个党派？

en: You may as well tell me all about it.
zh: 你还不如把一切都告诉我。

en: You may choose either of the two books.
zh: 你可以选择这两本书中的任何一本。

en: You have to report to the police at once.
zh: 你必须立即向警方报告。

en: All you have to do is wait on any customers that come to the shop.
zh: 你所要做的就是接待来商店的任何顾客。

en: You can't go naked in this hotel.
zh: 你不能在这个酒店里裸体。

en: You must always keep your hands clean.
zh: 你必须始终保持双手清洁。

en: You are always digging at me about my clothes.
zh: 你总是挑剔我的衣服。

en: When did you begin learning German?
zh: 你什么时候开始学习德语的？

en: Please go on with your story.
zh: 请继续讲你的故事。

en: Your story doesn't corroborate what I've heard before.
zh: 你的故事与我之前听到的不符。

en: There may be some truth in your story.
zh: 你的故事里可能有些真相。

en: Your story reminded me of my younger days.
zh: 你的故事让我想起了我的年轻时代。

en: Assuming your story is true, what should I do?
zh: 假设你的故事是真的，我该怎么办？

en: Judging from what you say, he must be a great scholar.
zh: 听你这么说，他一定是个大学者。

en: In the light of what you told us, I think we should revise our plan.
zh: 根据你告诉我们的情况，我认为我们应该修改我们的计划。

en: I can hardly hear you.
zh: 我几乎听不见你说话。

en: Omit needless words!
zh: 省略不必要的词语！

en: Please give me your permanent address.
zh: 请给我你的永久地址。

en: Your parents didn't come, did they?
zh: 你的父母没来，是吗？

en: His stock with the students has soared.
zh: 他在学生中的声望大大提高。

en: Do you have a student fare?
zh: 有学生票吗？

en: The student hall is for benefit of the students.
zh: 学生会堂是为了学生们的利益而设的。

en: There are several restrictions on working to support yourself abroad on a student visa.
zh: 持学生签证在国外工作以维持生计有若干限制。

en: Students should develop their reading skills.
zh: 学生应该培养他们的阅读能力。

en: Students are supposed to study hard.
zh: 学生应该努力学习。

en: Students should try not to be late.
zh: 学生应该尽量不要迟到。

en: Every student has access to the library.
zh: 每个学生都可以使用图书馆。

en: The students are for the most part diligent.
zh: 学生们大部分都很勤奋。

en: A student spends a lot of time studying.
zh: 一个学生花很多时间学习。

en: Students have a holiday on Foundation Day.
zh: 学生在建国日放假。

en: Students have access to the library.
zh: 学生可以使用图书馆。

en: Students should make use of the books in the library.
zh: 学生应该利用图书馆里的书籍。

en: Students must keep silent during a class.
zh: 学生上课时必须保持安静。

en: Students should make the most of their free time.
zh: 学生应该充分利用他们的空闲时间。

en: A student should not lose sight of his own identity.
zh: 学生不应该迷失自我。

en: Students are apt to waste time.
zh: 学生很容易浪费时间。

en: Students are longing for the vacation.
zh: 学生们渴望假期。

en: Students are supposed to turn in reports at the end of the school year.
zh: 学生应该在学年结束时提交报告。

en: All of the students stood up together.
zh: 所有的学生一起站了起来。

en: Each student received his diploma in turn.
zh: 每个学生依次收到他的毕业证书。

en: All the students protested against the war.
zh: 所有的学生都抗议战争。

en: The student left without saying anything.
zh: 那个学生什么也没说就离开了。

en: Students often study with music playing in the background, and people working around the house will usually turn on the television or radio to keep them company.
zh: 学生们经常在播放音乐的背景下学习，在房子周围工作的人通常会打开电视或收音机来陪伴他们。

en: Students bustled about all the night.
zh: 学生们整夜忙碌奔波。

en: How wonderful a time we have had!
zh: 我们度过了多么美好的时光啊！

en: How well she is singing!
zh: 她唱得多么好啊！

en: How serious I looked!
zh: 我看起来多么严肃啊！

en: What a pity!
zh: 多么可惜啊！

en: What splendid houses they are!
zh: 他们是多么漂亮的房子啊！

en: I am at a loss for what I have to say.
zh: 我不知道该说什么才好。

en: I didn't know what to say.
zh: 我不知道该说什么。

en: Let me have your suggestion as to what I am to say.
zh: 请你给我提个建议，我该说什么。

en: How blue the sky is!
zh: 天空多么蓝啊！

en: He exclaimed, "What a dirty face you have!"
zh: 他惊叫道：“你有一张多么脏的脸啊！”

en: I can't say for sure.
zh: 我不能确定。

en: What an incredible amount of work he has done!
zh: 他完成了多么惊人的工作量啊！

en: I can't say.
zh: 我说不好。

en: I have no words to express my gratitude.
zh: 我无法用语言表达我的感激之情。

en: I sort of understand.
zh: 我有点明白了。

en: Boy, did she have egg on her face when she showed up at the formal party wearing blue jeans!
zh: 天哪，当她穿着蓝色牛仔裤出现在正式聚会上时，她真是丢脸死了！

en: How fast the plane is!
zh: 飞机多么快啊！

en: I must save her at all costs.
zh: 我不惜一切代价也要救她。

en: What a marvelous sight!
zh: 多么壮丽的景象啊！

en: What a heavenly dress!
zh: 多么漂亮的裙子啊！

en: We must prevent war at any cost.
zh: 我们必须不惜一切代价阻止战争。

en: We've got to break out tonight or I'll go crazy!
zh: 我们今晚必须逃出去，否则我会疯掉的！

en: I ache for a sight of the sea.
zh: 我渴望看到大海。

en: I must save the drowning child by all means.
zh: 我必须尽一切努力救那个溺水的孩子。

en: We must prevent the fire from reaching the gunpowder at any cost.
zh: 我们必须不惜一切代价阻止火势蔓延到火药。

en: We failed due to a lack of preparation.
zh: 我们因为缺乏准备而失败了。

en: You may rest assured that we shall do all we can.
zh: 您可以放心，我们会尽一切努力。

en: We should strike a balance between our expenditure and income.
zh: 我们应该在支出和收入之间取得平衡。

en: There is nothing for it but to put off our departure.
zh: 我们别无选择，只能推迟出发。

en: In the fall we harvest our summer crops.
zh: 秋天我们收获夏季作物。

en: We negotiated with the president about our working hours.
zh: 我们和总统就工作时间进行了谈判。

en: We looked about us.
zh: 我们环顾四周。

en: We're eating up a lot of time writing letters by hand.
zh: 我们手写信件浪费了很多时间。

en: We can dispose the car.
zh: 我们可以处理掉这辆车。

en: We agreed to refrain from smoking while we are at work.
zh: 我们同意在工作时戒烟。

en: We must work hard to break down social barriers.
zh: 我们必须努力打破社会障碍。

en: We have to put right what we have done wrong.
zh: 我们必须纠正我们所做错的事情。

en: We stand for liberty.
zh: 我们支持自由。

en: It is important that we should do our duty.
zh: 重要的是我们应该履行我们的职责。

en: We are to preserve nature.
zh: 我们要保护自然。

en: We cannot subdue nature.
zh: 我们无法征服自然。

en: We have to transmit our culture to the next generation.
zh: 我们必须将我们的文化传承给下一代。

en: We've fixed on starting next Sunday.
zh: 我们已经决定下周日开始。

en: We should read the newspaper so as not to lag behind the times.
zh: 我们应该阅读报纸，以免落后于时代。

en: We must keep up with the times.
zh: 我们必须跟上时代的步伐。

en: We should sometimes expose our bodies to the sun.
zh: 我们应该偶尔让我们的身体晒晒太阳。

en: We are apt to waste time.
zh: 我们很容易浪费时间。

en: We value punctuality.
zh: 我们重视准时。

en: We regard the situation as serious.
zh: 我们认为情况很严重。

en: We have to make a close analysis of the accident.
zh: 我们必须对事故进行详细的分析。
